How to setup React SPA from scratch in 2020 (Unformatted Article)

  1. Create your project folder

  2. Run npm init -y to create manifest (package.json) of your project

    Setup React base with webpack

  3. yarn add react react-dom prop-types babel-polyfill
  4. yarn add -D webpack webpack-cli webpack-dev-server @babel/core @babel/preset-env @babel/preset-react babel-cli babel-loader html-webpack-plugin

  5. Create index.html inside directory src/templates

    <!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
Page Title
``` 4. Create `index.js` and `App.jsx` under directory `src/`

index.js

import 'babel-polyfill'
import React from 'react'
import ReactDOM from 'react-dom'
import App from './App'

ReactDOM.render(<App />, document.getElementById('root'))

App.jsx

import React from 'react'

const App = () => {
  return (
    <main>
      <h1>Hello world!</h1>
    </main>
  )
}

export default App

5.. Create webpack.config.js under root directory

const webpack = require('webpack')
const path = require('path')
const HtmlWebpackPlugin = require('html-webpack-plugin')

module.exports = (_, { mode } = {}) => {
  return {
    mode,
    output: {
      path: path.resolve(__dirname, 'public'),
      filename: 'bundle-[hash].js',
      publicPath: '/'
    },
    devtool: 'eval-source-map',
    module: {
      rules: [
        {
          test: /.(js|jsx)$/,
          loader: 'babel-loader',
          include: [path.resolve(__dirname, 'src')],
          exclude: /node_modules/,
          options: {
            presets: [
              '@babel/react',
              [
                '@babel/env',
                { modules: false, targets: { browsers: ['last 2 versions'] } }
              ]
            ]
          }
        }
      ]
    },
    resolve: {
      modules: [path.resolve(__dirname, 'src'), 'node_modules'],
      extensions: ['*', '.js', '.jsx']
    },
    devServer: {
      contentBase: path.join(__dirname, 'public'),
      host: 'localhost',
      port: 8888,
      historyApiFallback: true,
      hot: true,
    },
    plugins: [
      new HtmlWebpackPlugin({
        filename: 'index.html',
        template: 'src/templates/index.html'
      }),
      new webpack.DefinePlugin({
        'process.env.NODE_ENV': JSON.stringify(mode),
      })
    ]
  }
}

6.. In package.json, create a script : webpack-dev-server --mode development --open --config webpack.config.js7.. Run commandyarn start`, browser will auto open the project, modify the App.jsx, hot reload should works

## Setup webpack for css and sass
1. `yarn add -D node-sass autoprefixer postcss-loader css-loader mini-css-extract-plugin autoprefixer sass-loader sass-resources-loader`
2. Update `webpack.confing.js` into following
```js
const webpack = require('webpack')
const path = require('path')
const HtmlWebpackPlugin = require('html-webpack-plugin')

const autoprefixer = require('autoprefixer')
const MiniCssExtractPlugin = require('mini-css-extract-plugin')

const CssModuleLoader = {
  loader: 'css-loader',
  options: {
    modules: {
      mode: 'local',
      localIdentName: '[path][name]__[local]--[hash:base64:5]',
      context: path.resolve(__dirname, 'src'),
      hashPrefix: 'my-custom-hash',
    },
  }
}

const postCssLoader = {
  loader: 'postcss-loader',
  options: {
    ident: 'postcss',
    plugins: () => [autoprefixer]
  }
}

const sassOptions = {
  loader: 'sass-resources-loader',
  options: {
    resources: 'src/assets/scss/*.scss' // Import all scss
  }
}

module.exports = (_, { mode } = {}) => {
  return {
    mode,
    output: {
      path: path.resolve(__dirname, 'public'),
      filename: 'bundle-[hash].js',
      publicPath: '/'
    },
    devtool: 'eval-source-map',
    module: {
      rules: [
        {
          test: /.(js|jsx)$/,
          loader: 'babel-loader',
          include: [path.resolve(__dirname, 'src')],
          exclude: /node_modules/,
          options: {
            presets: [
              '@babel/react',
              [
                '@babel/env',
                { modules: false, targets: { browsers: ['last 2 versions'] } }
              ]
            ]
          }
        },
        {
          test: /\.module\.s(a|c)ss$/,
          use: [
            {
              loader: MiniCssExtractPlugin.loader,
              options: {
                hmr: true
              }
            },
            CssModuleLoader,
            postCssLoader,
            'sass-loader',
            sassOptions
          ]
        },
        {
          test: /\.s(a|c)ss$/,
          exclude: /\.module\.s(a|c)ss$/,
          use: [
            {
              loader: MiniCssExtractPlugin.loader,
              options: {
                hmr: true
              }
            },
            'css-loader',
            postCssLoader,
            'sass-loader',
            sassOptions
          ]
        }
        ,
        {
          test: /\.css$/,
          use: [
            {
              loader: MiniCssExtractPlugin.loader,
              options: {
                hmr: true
              }
            },
            'css-loader',
            postCssLoader
          ]
        }
      ]
    },
    resolve: {
      modules: [path.resolve(__dirname, 'src'), 'node_modules'],
      extensions: ['*', '.js', '.jsx']
    },
    devServer: {
      contentBase: path.join(__dirname, 'public'),
      host: 'localhost',
      port: 8888,
      historyApiFallback: true,
      hot: true,
    },
    plugins: [
      new HtmlWebpackPlugin({  // Also generate a test.html
        filename: 'index.html',
        template: 'src/templates/index.html'
      }),
      new webpack.DefinePlugin({
        'process.env.NODE_ENV': JSON.stringify(mode),
      }),
      new MiniCssExtractPlugin({
        filename: '[name].css',
        chunkFilename: '[id].css'
      })
    ]
  }
}

## Setup Redux, Redux saga and debugging tools
1. `yarn add react-redux redux redux-saga connected-react-router redux-devtools-extension redux-logger`
2. Create a file `reducers/index.js`, with following code
```js
import { combineReducers } from 'redux'
import { connectRouter } from 'connected-react-router'

const reducers = {}

const rootReducer = history =>
  combineReducers({
    router: connectRouter(history),
    ...reducers
  })

export default rootReducer

  1. create a file sagas/index.js

    import { all, put } from 'redux-saga/effects'
import { push } from 'connected-react-router'

export function* helloSaga() { console.log('Hello Sagas!') yield put(push('/example')) }

export default function* rootSaga() { yield all([ helloSaga(), ]) }

4. Update following file `src/index.js` into following
```js
import 'babel-polyfill'
import React from 'react'
import ReactDOM from 'react-dom'
import App from './App'

import reducers from './reducers'
import { Provider } from 'react-redux'
import { createStore, applyMiddleware } from 'redux'
import createSagaMiddleware from 'redux-saga'
import { composeWithDevTools } from 'redux-devtools-extension'
import { createBrowserHistory } from 'history'
import { routerMiddleware, ConnectedRouter } from 'connected-react-router'
import logger from 'redux-logger'
import rootSaga from './sagas'

const history = createBrowserHistory()
const sagaMiddleware = createSagaMiddleware()

const middlewares = [
  sagaMiddleware,
  process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' && logger,
  routerMiddleware(history)
].filter(Boolean)

const store = createStore(
  reducers(history),
  {},
  process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development'
    ? composeWithDevTools(applyMiddleware(...middlewares))
    : applyMiddleware(...middlewares)
)

sagaMiddleware.run(rootSaga)

ReactDOM.render(
  <Provider store={store}>
    <App />
  </Provider>, document.getElementById('root'))

5, Navigate to landing page, and refresh, open console tab, you should see the hello Saga message a logger for the push event.

  1. You can also download redux dev tools extension and react debugger

  1. yarn add -D eslint babel-eslint eslint-plugin-react prettier prettier-stylelint husky lint-staged stylelint-prettier

  2. Create .eslintrc.js in root directory

commonjs: true,
es6: true,
jest: true,
browser: true,
node: true
},

    {

"printWidth": 80,
"tabWidth": 2,
"singleQuote": true,
"trailingComma": "none",
"bracketSpacing": true,
"semi": false,

"proseWrap": "always"
}

  4. Create .stylelintrc under root directory

    {
"plugins": ["stylelint-prettier"],
"rules": {
"prettier/prettier": true
}
}
  5. Install eslint extension, you should see eslint report an error in index.js line 12, go and fix it

  6. Go to package.json add following code into scripts

    {
"prettier": "prettier",
"lint:fix": "eslint --fix .",
"starter": "yarn && yarn start",
"prettier:style": "prettier-stylelint --write 'src/**/*.{css,scss}'"
}

  7. Add following code in the same level with scripts

    "husky": {
"hooks": {
  "pre-commit": "lint-staged"
}
},
"lint-staged": {
"*.{js,jsx}": [
  "prettier --write",
  "eslint --fix",
  "git add"
],
"*.{css,scss}": [
  "prettier-stylelint --write",
  "git add"
]
},
  8. Your code will now auto prettify in pre commit stage
